eb27eefa-1d9f-547b-b672-cb7e9b839efd.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to removing any vegetation or habitat, FH shall: (a) arrange an on-site inspection with the Superintendent relevant authorities to confirm and clearly identify and mark trees, vegetation or habitat to be removed, consistent with the Design Documents and any relevant permits. (b) fence and sign all sites nominated as No-Go Zones.

1b918ad0-0d0f-5062-b429-d80a5e0ab730.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas determined to be No-Go Zones are securely fenced and clearly identified by signage installed in the fencing. Immediately notify the Superintendent if any Cultural Heritage is discovered or identified during construction and work to be suspended. Works may recommence with the cultural heritage approval or if works can resume without risk to the discovered Cultural Heritage.

meta.name: 2.1 Identification of Cultural Heritage sites and areas of Cultural Significance

843858e1-3c47-56d3-ad6c-78d9fe60420b.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where soil is stockpiled on Site, such stockpiles shall be located, where possible, to provide a clearance of not less than 10 metres from waterways. If this clearance is not possible, additional protection shall be provided. An area for stockpiling of topsoil has been designated and marked according Work Procedure WP-0009

5e9490d9-9cdd-50a6-ac8c-736cf1c0c363.title: INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection

20b6f318-f750-5760-972c-3cd486d72be7.title: REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Relevant EMP Project Spec. Cl.1200.16 VicRoads Spec. Cl.204.05

8820c0a2-8350-5150-878f-c97c36d3574d.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Topsoil shall be stripped for the full width of the formation. Declared noxious weeds, pests and pathogens shall be treated and monitored before stripping of topsoil, and after spreading, to prevent and/or minimise the spread of weeds and other pathogens throughout the site. Stockpiles shall be maintained in a neat, well shaped state capable of shedding water. Topsoil shall be re spread as soon as practicable.

ebb0bbfb-a83c-5a29-8a0d-a0e53c7f1af7.title: FREQUENCY: Prior and after commencement of any ground disturbing activities

017009ad-e2bc-521f-b9f7-eaa1047a2df2.title: REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec. Cl.3020.07(a)(i) VicRoads Spec. Cl.201.05 Excavation Permit # IFC Drawings

30207abe-9bd6-5d45-8e66-76a726a58c90.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Removal and disposal of abandoned services and obsolete underground drainage lines which interfere with the execution of works has been done. Verify service is not likely to contain a hazardous material (sewage, asbestos pipe) Decommissioned services to be disposed of in a suitable manner. Decommissioned pits have been broken back to 0.3 metres below subgrade level.

ce3ae9eb-acc3-5885-ba62-fe58bbad778f.title: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing this work

8ca7c65a-f225-5787-9ea3-7cbbe7a1a114.title: Where whole branches are to be removed, the three cut method shall be used.

3329a53d-2bb6-5d27-bdcf-9bf7ac90cb8f.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clearing work shall not be undertake outside of the specified limits of work. Tree branches extending over the carriageway shall be trimmed to provide a clearance of at least 6 m above the carriageway surface.

232d22e2-0fca-508e-b153-eebb46002066.title: 1. only non-habitat trees as identified by the the ecologist are to be removed

a3df9aef-3f53-50b0-a090-ea34cb3e6c81.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tree Clearing shall be done in a 2 stages:

323c331d-c352-5038-bf4b-9b1a5b35d3fc.title: 2. the removal of habitat trees must occur not less than 24 hours after the removal of non-habitat trees in the area

166c0d3d-895e-5dce-85bf-689bd394600f.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation will be made, all vegetation, refuse and obstructions shall be totally grubbed or grubbed to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the subgrade and batters, whichever is the lesser treatment.

9f613617-f954-523c-a27d-dd098d3556ff.title: In areas to be covered by embankments, to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the stripped surface or not less than 0.6 m below the finished surface of the subgrade, whichever is the lesser treatment. Holes resulting from grubbing shall be backfilled with material similar to the surrounding material and compacted to the same degree as the surrounding material

ccded32a-2df3-5e00-bc62-52860088e4c0.title: REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec. Cl.3020.07(a) VicRoads Spec. Cl.201.05

ae304dba-704c-5e7e-979b-3280d4fee8d5.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tree trunks and large branches shall be removed from the site. Small tree branches, shrubs and leaves, excluding noxious weeds, shall be disposed of by chipping and mulching to form mulch.

778be8a5-532f-54fb-883d-eb8da2c52dab.title: REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec. Cl.3020.07(k), VicRoads Specification Cl.204.17

162b2b5b-bb53-5add-bf51-af7f2d00c07b.title: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All disturbed and/or not paved areas shall be topsoiled according to Section 204 of VicRoads Standard for Roadworks and Bridge works, to the following minimum depths - Batter slopes > 2:1 = 50mm -tree and shrub plantation bed areas= 100mm - Verge, 50mm outer edge / 20mm when within 100mm of the edge of seal or asphalt surface treatment - All other areas - 75mm Topsoil should be levelled and spread, but not compacted, except for verge areas.
